main event: A witness observed a bright, unusual airborne object in Tijeras Canyon, New Mexico on August 18, 1966.
interesting points: The witness initially thought the object was a satellite but later deduced it could not be due to its tracking direction., The object was described as having a bright nose light and additional smaller lights without any visible silhouette., Other aircraft flying in the area were not detected by air traffic control., The witness reported that the object suddenly disappeared without a trace in clear sky., The witness, a former airline pilot, questioned the conventional explanations for the object's behavior.
sighted object: a bright, unusual airborne object with multiple lights
witness description: a 48-year-old employed as a research manufacturer/photographer for Lockheed Precision Products, with previous experience as a commercial pilot
